item.title: 工厂数据刺激降息押注回落，美债下滑
item.description: 美国工厂活动数据好于预期，导致投资者略微降低了对美国今年降息的押注，国债随之下滑。【原文：Treasuries slipped after better-than-feared data on US factory activity caused investors to slightly curb their bets on US interest-rate cuts this year.】

item.title: 应对关税风险，庞巴迪重启指导计划
item.description: 庞巴迪公司（Bombardier Inc.）在上一季度暂停发布盈利指引后，本季度再次发布了2025年的盈利指引，因为这家喷气机制造商认为其多元化的收入足以帮助其渡过不确定的经济环境。【原文：Bombardier Inc. is offering earnings guidance for 2025 again after pausing last quarter, as the jet manufacturer sees its diversified revenue as strong enough to help it navigate through an uncertain economic environment.】

item.title: 尽管计划增产，欧佩克上月石油产量仍有所下降
item.description: 尽管欧佩克制定了期待已久的增产计划，但上个月该组织的原油产量仍有所下降，减产的主要原因是美国对委内瑞拉的制裁迫在眉睫。【原文：OPEC’s crude production fell last month despite the group’s long-awaited plans to increase, with much of the reduction stemming from looming US sanctions on Venezuela.】

item.title: 萨默斯称 "市场告诉美联储应该减产 "是错误的
item.description: 前财政部长劳伦斯-萨默斯（Lawrence Summers）说，债券市场的定价并不等同于对美联储应如何处理利率问题的判断，决策者下周放宽政策将是一个 "非常严重的错误"。【原文：Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said that bond-market pricing doesn’t amount to a judgment call on what the Federal Reserve ought to do with interest rates, and that it would be a “very serious error” for policymakers to ease next week.】

item.title: 象牙海岸可可质量下降，可可供应困境加剧
item.description: 世界第一大可可生产国象牙海岸的可可研磨商正在为劣质可可豆而苦苦挣扎，因为从农场运来的可可豆中混入了大量废料，这给本已紧张的全球市场带来了更大的压力。【原文：Cocoa grinders in Ivory Coast, the world’s top producer, are struggling with poor-quality beans with unusually high levels of waste material mixed into deliveries arriving from farms, piling on pressure to an already tight global market.】

item.title: LinkedIn 在视频推广中与创作者分享广告收入
item.description: 由于视频内容增加了人们在网站上花费的时间，LinkedIn 将首次开始与创作者分享广告收入。【原文：LinkedIn will begin sharing advertising revenue with creators for the first time, as video content boosts the amount of time people spend on the site.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉恳求中国购买石油，特朗普将雪佛龙拒之门外
item.description: 委内瑞拉副总统德尔西-罗德里格斯（Delcy Rodríguez）上周访问北京时要求中国官员加大石油采购力度，因为委内瑞拉希望在美国下令雪佛龙公司和其他外国能源运营商下月撤出之前先发制人。【原文：Venezuelan Vice President Delcy Rodríguez asked Chinese officials to step up oil purchases during a visit to Beijing last week, as the nation seeks to preempt the US-ordered exit of Chevron Corp. and other foreign energy operators next month.】

item.title: Thrivent 出售与基金股权相关的 12 亿美元债务
item.description: 保险公司和资金管理公司 Thrivent 以其部分基金的现金流为支持发行了 12 亿美元的债务，这是今年结构性融资浪潮中的最新一笔，旨在为私人资本管理公司释放流动性。【原文：Insurer and money manager Thrivent issued $1.2 billion of debt backed by cash flows from some of its fund-of-funds, the latest in a wave of structured financings this year aimed at freeing up liquidity for private capital managers.】

item.title: 关税暴跌后，高收益债券创下 2023 年以来最差月度表现
item.description: 高收益市政债券创下了自 2023 年 9 月以来最差的一个月，因为这些证券正在努力挽回本月初关税引发的抛售所造成的损失。【原文：High-yield municipal bonds posted their worst month since September 2023 as the securities struggle to recoup losses from the tariff-fueled selloff earlier this month.】

item.title: 特朗普计划访问阿联酋，美国考虑放宽对阿联酋的英伟达芯片限制
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士称，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普可能会在即将开始的海湾之行中宣布启动双边芯片交易。【原文：The US is weighing a potential easing of restrictions on Nvidia Corp. sales to the United Arab Emirates, according to people familiar with the matter, who said President Donald Trump could announce the start of work on a bilateral chip deal during his upcoming trip to the Gulf.】

item.title: 麦艾文认为黄金股市将在黄金价格冲上 5,000 美元的过程中蓬勃发展
item.description: 加拿大矿业资深人士罗布-麦艾文（Rob McEwen）认为，金银的破纪录上涨将吸引投资者重返黄金矿业股，导致贵金属生产商的股票出现 "爆炸性 "表现。【原文：Bullion’s record-breaking run will attract investors back to gold mining stocks, leading to “explosive” performance in shares of producers of the precious metal, according to Canadian mining industry veteran Rob McEwen.】

item.title: 大型人工智能项目为私人信贷带来 1.8 万亿美元的资金池
item.description: 人工智能的蓬勃发展推动了私人信贷公司的业务，因为科技公司正在寻求资金，以建立装满计算芯片的数据中心，从而运行人工智能模型。【原文：The artificial intelligence boom is driving business to private credit firms, as tech companies seek funding to build data centers filled with computing chips to operate AI models.】

item.title: 秘鲁 4 月通胀加速超过预期
item.description: 4 月份，秘鲁首都的通货膨胀率上升速度超过预期，但仍保持在中央银行的目标范围内。【原文：Inflation in Peru’s capital rose faster than expected in April, but remains comfortably within the central bank’s target band.】

item.title: 即使特朗普站在比特币矿工一边，他们也会看到黯淡的一季度
item.description: 去年，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在竞选活动中承诺要成为美国比特币采矿业的拥护者。然而，随着美国加密货币矿商开始发布特朗普重返白宫后的首份季度财报，该集团显然正在苦苦挣扎。【原文：Last year on the campaign trail, Donald Trump promised to be a champion of the Bitcoin mining industry in the US. Yet as American crypto miners begin to release their first quarterly earnings reports since Trump returned to the White House, it’s clear the group is struggling.】

item.title: 路透社称 Third Point 持有美国钢铁公司 "有意义 "的股份
item.description: 据路透社报道，Third Point 拥有美国钢铁公司 "重要 "的股份，并预计新日铁的合并将继续进行。【原文：Third Point owns a “meaningful” stake in US Steel and expects the Nippon Steel merger to go ahead, Reuters reported.】

item.title: 花旗是最后一家在财报后出售债券的美国大银行
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Citigroup Inc. is tapping the US high-grade bond market Thursday, becoming the last of the biggest US banks to enter the market after reporting first-quarter earnings.】

item.title: 微软在贸易战中提高 Xbox 和游戏售价
item.description: 微软公司正在提高其 Xbox 游戏、游戏机和配件的价格，因为目前的贸易战将如何影响游戏行业的供应链还存在更广泛的不确定性。【原文：Microsoft Corp is raising prices on its Xbox games, consoles and accessories amid broader uncertainty about how the ongoing trade wars will impact supply chains in the gaming industry.】

item.title: 美国制造业活动创 11 月以来最大降幅
item.description: 由于订单量减少以及关税的影响，美国制造业活动在 4 月份出现了自 2020 年以来最大幅度的萎缩，萎缩幅度为 5 个月之最。【原文：US manufacturing activity shrank in April by the most in five months as lean order books and the repercussions from tariffs prompted the steepest output contraction since 2020.】

item.title: Albemarle 认为高成本锂生产商面临的压力越来越大
item.description: 全球最大的锂供应商 Albemarle 公司预计，成本较高的电池金属生产商将面临更多的痛苦，其中许多生产商正因低价而亏损。【原文：Albemarle Corp., the world’s biggest lithium supplier, is anticipating more pain for higher cost producers of the battery metal, many of which are losing money due to low prices.】

item.title: 关税增加新风险，农用机械持续低迷
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）断断续续征收的关税给农作物需求蒙上了阴影，并有可能进一步延长该行业多年来的低迷期，农民们仍在推迟设备采购。【原文：Farmers are still delaying equipment purchases as US President Donald Trump’s on-and-off tariffs cloud demand for crops and risk further extending a years-long slump in the sector.】

item.title: 施瓦布警告：贸易战导致波动性飙升，数千人面临追加保证金的风险
item.description: 嘉信理财公司（Charles Schwab Corp）首席执行官里克-沃斯特（Rick Wurster）表示，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易战导致股市下挫，该公司上个月给数千名接近追加保证金的零售投资客户打了电话。【原文：Charles Schwab Corp. telephoned thousands of its retail-investing customers who were close to margin calls last month as US President Donald Trump’s trade war sent stocks sinking, Chief Executive Officer Rick Wurster said.】

item.title: AIB 股东批准 12 亿欧元爱尔兰国家回购计划
item.description: 爱尔兰国际银行集团（AIB Group Plc）股东投票决定从爱尔兰国家手中回购价值 12 亿欧元（14 亿美元）的股份，从而使该贷款机构濒临完全私有化。【原文：AIB Group Plc shareholders voted to buy back €1.2 billion ($1.4 billion) worth of shares from the Irish state, putting the lender on the verge of full private ownership.】

item.title: Instacart 收购杂货技术提供商 Wynshop 以推进软件发展
item.description: Instacart 收购了美国食品杂货连锁店电子商务平台 Wynshop Inc.，为这家快递公司不断增长的零售商软件业务锦上添花。【原文：Instacart has acquired Wynshop Inc., an e-commerce platform for US grocery chains, adding to the delivery company’s growing software business for retailers.】

item.title: 特朗普试图将经济问题归咎于拜登，却忽视了关税的影响
item.description: 面对糟糕的经济消息，唐纳德-特朗普总统开始在告诉美国人要有耐心和指责他的前任之间摇摆不定，这让他很容易失去那些选举他来改善国家经济的选民的支持。【原文：President Donald Trump has started vacillating between telling Americans to be patient in the face of bad economic news and blaming his predecessor for it, leaving him vulnerable to losing the support of voters who elected him to improve the nation’s economy.】

item.title: 押注欧洲央行 9 月前降息的期权大受欢迎
item.description: 交易商们正在抢购与欧洲央行 9 月利率决定相关的赌注，而不是 6 月的赌注，当时降息四分之一个百分点已被视为板上钉钉的事。【原文：Traders are scooping up wagers tied to the European Central Bank’s interest-rate decision in September, moving on from bets on June when a quarter-point cut is seen as a foregone conclusion.】

item.title: 美国股市反弹进入第 8 天，接近抹平关税后的跌势
item.description: 一连串稳健的企业财报推动美国股市在隔夜交易中走高，使主要股指有望实现八连涨，并接近抹平唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布征收重大关税后遭受的所有损失。【原文：A spate of solid corporate earnings pushed US stocks higher in overnight trading, putting major indexes on track for an eighth straight advance and close to wiping out all of the losses suffered after Donald Trump’s major tariff announcement.】

item.title: 纳斯达克计划将使零日期权繁荣更接近单一股票
item.description: 纳斯达克公司（Nasdaq Inc. ）希望增加英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.【原文：Nasdaq Inc. wants to increase the number of days that options on megacaps like Nvidia Corp. and Tesla Inc. can expire, in what could be a key step toward expanding Wall Street’s zero-day trading boom to single stocks.】

item.title: 复活节后美国申请失业救济人数跃升至二月份以来最高点
item.description: 在复活节后的一周内，美国失业救济金申请人数跃升至二月份以来的最高水平。【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits jumped to the highest level since February during the week that followed Easter.】

item.title: 太阳能发电激增迫使核电削减，法国电力大幅下滑
item.description: 法国的电力价格再次跌破零点，因为太阳能席卷了电网，迫使该国庞大的核电机组削减产量。【原文：French power prices again tumbled below zero as solar energy swamped the grid, forcing the country’s vast nuclear fleet to slash output.】
